Thanks to the healthy beating he had received at his old comrade's hands the day before, Geddoe was much slower in rising than usual, and slept off his pain in the quiet of his now empty room. Roy had thrown a tantrum and gone off by himself, but since he had Nash trailing him, Geddoe figured it was fine to let him go be a teenager. He had finally risen, tended his bruises, and dressed, and was considering going out to see if Belcoot's bout with Kyle had been scheduled.

While still preferring his usual sleuthing techniques, Richmond had decided that the frontal approach was the best way to go with thetactiturn mercenary. Therefore this morning saw the gumshoe standing in front of Geddoe's door, politely rapping on it with his knuckles.

Geddoe raised his head from attending to his gloves. "Who is it?"

"Housekeeping." Richmond looked up and down the corridor, making sure no one else was around, before continuing. "Richmond, private eye, and I'm trying to talk to a Geddoe about something that really shouldn't be talked about in the hallway with a door between 'em."

Geddoe stepped over and opened the door, vaguely curious, but certain it couldn't be anyone else with a blunt and cryptic greeting like that. "Private eye?" he questioned upon seeing the other man's haggard face. "I wasn't aware we had another one."

Richmond waves off Geddoe's remark, stepping inside before the other man can say anything else, and closes the door. "No offense, but I don't want to be caught out in the hallway with this business.Yuber gives me the creeps." He holds out a hand to Geddoe , smile in place. "Richmond's the name, and your little buddy Roy has set me on his case. I've got a few questions for you, if you got the time."

Geddoe instantly relaxed his wary stance, though he eyed the hand offered him before shaking it firmly. "Very well. If it's on Roy's behalf, I can manage the time to talk."

"I won't keep ya long, I'm sure you're a busy man, but I've noticed your name comin' up a lot lately..." Richmond keeps a friendly eye on Geddoe's face, trying to read any signals there. "You were around when Yuber was chattin' with Lyon, is that right?"

"Yes," Geddoe replied stoically. "I was there. I walked in after they'd already been talking."

"Hear anything interesting? I'll be straightforward with you here...Roy's got a couple of really not-so-nice people up against him and right now, while there are a lot of folks around, it's still his word against Luca's. Did you hear Yuber threaten Lyon? Say anything that might lead to a motive other than that Yuber is a crazy bastard?"

Geddoe's eye darkened. "Well. I take it you're already acquainted with Yuber, then." He shook his head. "He claimed that he attacked her because he was bored, and I believe him. That's his nature. He doesn't need provocation, and I would think that being tied down to the castle grounds has made him frustrated and in need of a little bloodshed."

Richmond sighs, rubbing his face with a hand in frustration. "Yeah....I am, and that's what I was afraid of. Damn." He sighs again, looking up at the mercenary captain. "So Yuber's a crazy bastard, all right...got any intel on why Luca would accuse Roy of letting him out? Sounds like Yuber and Roy weren't friends, but his alibi is a little shakey."

"The only thing I can think of is that Luca's had a couple of run-ins with him," Geddoe speculated, "and probably just...picked him as the target. It's the most illogical target. Roy is like a puppy, in love with Lyon. He would never aid anyone who attacked her." He folded his arms over his chest sternly. "I've been keeping him safe here, in my room, since it happened. I've gotten to know him a little better. There's no truth to Luca's claim, I'd swear it."

"Hope we can convince the rest of the castle that thought, that's going to be the hard part." Richmond said, scratching his chin in a speculative way. "What'd he do to Luca, anyhow?"

Geddoe took on a disgusted look. "As far as I know, nothing," he complained. "Except run his mouth, which is just Roy being Roy. Luca chose to antagonize him at the holiday play, and again later."

"Heard about some ruckus at the play...so Roy was the other party involved, eh? Hmmm. You know anyone else that can vouch for Roy's whereabouts during the night Yuber was locked up? I know they headed out to shop the next day, but there was a whole night during that...."

"During that night, no." Geddoe became quite serious. "But as to the other claim, that Roy is responsible for kidnapping Thomas...I am the proof that it's a lie. Roy was here with me, under my protection, the night that happened."

"Anyone else see you two? Wouldn't take much for someone to just add you to the co-conspirator list." Richmond frowned, feeling that the hole in Roy's timeline was going to be difficult to fill indeed.

Geddoe did not look daunted in the least. "It shouldn't matter. My honor is above reproach. I am the bearer of True Lightning, the last living Fire Bringer. I have eighty years of history that the people around this castle look up to and respect." He closed his eye briefly. "But I know how the legal system works. I can't recall whether any of the others I saw greeting Roy in the lobby heard me say I was taking him into custody."

Richmond, who's eyes widen just a bit at all the information, stores it away for future reference like a kid hording candy, nibbling at it later. "Well...all right. Can't give me what you don't have, after all." He squints up at Geddoe, "Anything else you can think of that might help the kid?"

Geddoe looked away for a silent moment while he thought. So much had been going on, he barely remembered the night he had grabbed Roy and decided, in a split second, to protect him. "Just that, since then, a number of people have been made aware that Roy is under my protection, or has been. I've been trying to keep anything from happening to any of them, in some way or another. They're all innocent." He turned his head back toward Richmond. "Anything else is only my speculation, and I don't intend to share that so openly."

Richmond grinned, flipping a golden coin in the air and catching it, "Fair enough, but detectives specialize in speculation....we find out if it's fact or not." Turning, he makes his way to the door, hand pausing on the latch as his voice turns serious again. "I don't know how much you know about Luca or Yuber , but if you're laying claim to protect Roy, you better know that both of them are certifiable and no pushovers; you take them on and you got a good chance to end up dead." He smiles again, all cheer and friendliness. "Lemme know if you think of anything else. Take care of yourself, Geddoe, and that brat...he owes me big time for this."

"Believe me, I'm already aware of that," Geddoe said grouchily. "Yuber  was my enemy in the recent war, I know what he's capable of. And we've already crossed swords once since I got here. I expect things to get much worse before they get better." He looked away absently. "But as you're attempting to help Roy, I'll say thanks."

"Don't thank me yet," Richmond chuckled, stepping out the door, "Well, at least you know the grave you're diggin." With a little salute and a jaunty wave, Richmond set off down the hallway.

Richmond was hot on the trail, sleuthing through the snow as a sleuth does best...and lost his mark. Damn! He needed to find the young Falena girl and he thought she had come through the courtyard...

It was then that Lyon appeared not too far behind from the stranger.  She had caught a glimpse of him previously and her current alert state did not permit her to be careless around anyone.  Once she was sure he wasn't anyone she had seen with theblonde mysterious demon, she decided to make the approach herself.

"Hello!" She called to the unfamiliar individual.

Richmond jumped, turning in an ungraceful way to face his target...which had somehow gotten behind him. "Uh...hello!" Crap, now his plan was ruined! Time for plan B! "Out for a walk in this....weather?" He gestured to the falling snow around them.

Lyon blinked at him curiously, assessing the possibilities of who this man might be, before breaking into a smile.

"Yes." She nodded. "It's rather lovely today, isn't it?  I haven't seen snowfall often, so I thought I would make the most of it while I'm here."

Richmond nodded, looking at her uniform. "You're from Falena, right? I guess you wouldn't have seen too much of the white stuff, eh?"

"Why yes, I am." She replied as she glanced up at the sky. "And no.  It doesn't get this cold around Falena..." At least with the exception of certain places...

Lyon turned to him again, still studying his face and clothes.  He knew of Falena at least, opening the possibility that he was a learned man... or perhaps, someone who had more to say than just small talk.

"Is there something I might be able to help you with... Sir...?"

Richmond sighed, his breath steaming up, and thought that maybe he was getting too old for this; the kid has seen right through him! "Actually, there is, miss. Do you know a kid named Roy?"

She frowned slightly, though the smile on her face remained. "Yes.  I suppose this has something to do with the recent events, does it?"

Richmond nodded, deciding that straight questioning was going to be the order of the day. "Yes it does, miss. Seems like that young lad has been accused of some pretty hefty crimes....but he said thatYuber," The detective can't hold in a long-suffering sigh, "started it by going after you. That true?"

"O-oh..." This time, the smile faded completely.  "Yes...  I had confronted Yuber to ask for a reason for his attack and received something unsatisfying.  A-Are... Are you trying to help Roy?"

Richmond smiled toothily, flipping his coin. "That I am, miss, but I gotta tell ya, your friend ain't making this an easy thing. Can you tell me any reason whyYuber would have attacked you? Other than his being psychotic and all..."

"... He said..." she paused while concern grew on her features. "He said he was bored..."

Richmond sighed raggedly, hand going up to rub over his weary face. "You aren't making this easy, yanno. Good heavens, what ever happened to just simple lost kitten cases?!" Sighing again, he looked back down at Lyon, "So he said he was bored and just went after you for kicks, eh? Was anyone else around?"

The Queen's Knight glanced towards the ground with hands clasped before her.  She was already quite aware that she wasn't suitable to be questioned about what had happened withYuber.  Hearing the situation in such a fashion somehow felt like a blow to her pride as a knight.

"I'm sorry I can't be of any more assistance... but no.  I had questioned him alone at first, but..." She said quietly as she shook her head. "CaptainGeddoe was present near the end of our conversation.  He might have heard some of our words, but that's all I know.  I cannot speak for him."

At that, she bowed at the stranger.

"I truly am sorry."

"Geddoe, eh? I'll have to talk to him." Richmond took out a cigarette, puffing gently in the wind, and patted Lyon on the shoulder. "Don't worry about it, you've been helpful. I'm justtryin ' to figure it all out. So he attacked you after this, they slammed him in jail, then escaped when no one was looking...sounds fishy."

Standing up straight again, she looked at the older man hesitantly.  Perhaps this was the best time to ask...

"Um... if you don't mind... Might I ask who you are...?  Or why you're helping Roy?"

"Oh, sorry miss, the name's Richmond, and I'm a detective. I'm trying to round up any solid evidence I can find for your friend." The gumshoe sighed, "Although he sure as heck doesn't make it any easier, Blight ANDYuber, geez....well, anyhow, I'd appreciate it if you know anything to let me know, okay? Anything can help."

"O-Oh! A detective...! Like Kidd?" She bowed again. "It's very nice to meet you, Richmond.  My name is Lyon."

As for other things that could help.... Lyon placed a hand on her chin as she began to think.  Aside Yuber currently waltzing around somewhere without his weapons, there really wasn't anything else...
"I'm unsure if this will help but... Sir Luca..." she said with some doubt in her voice.  She was unsure if this was any help, but perhaps a detective can see something between the lines. "The night after I was attacked, I met Sir Luca just over at the fountain and he asked me aboutYuber .  After that... he said that he would take care of him for me.  That's why...  I don't exactly understand why Sir Luca would lie...  But--" she looked up at Richmond with brows furrowed. "Roy wouldn't do such a thing either...!  And LadySialeeds or the others aren't bandits...!"

Richmond grinned at Lyon, "Nice to meet you too, Lyon." Richmond stood with his cigarette contemplatively, nodding at what the young woman said. "Luca again...damn. Well, this does help, thanks."

What...? Really...?  Lyon blinked at the older man.  "Um.... May I ask how..?"

"Too many of the same names showing up in the same places...but looking for a motive for Yuber's actions is like...like...," Richmond gestures outward, trying to think up something grand, but failing, "Well, it's damn hard, the man is unpredictable and I don't want to get closer to him than I have to, but I'd sure as hell like to know what Luca was doing aroundYuber...that's not a connection I like seeing at all."

"... Have you dealt with them both before...?"  She started only to wave her hands in front of her as she flustered a little. "I-I'm sorry if that was too personal to ask..! You don't need to answer..!"

Richmond laughed, thinking Lyon was rather cute for a young knight. "It's fine, don't worry! Yeah, I've dealt with them both before, or as much as I cared to."

"O-Oh..." she clasped her hands together again, trying her best to get the annoying flush to disappear from her cheeks. "S-So... has... Sir Luca always been so...."

What was the word to use? Eccentric? Odd? ... Misguided...?

"Er... 'special'...?" ... that didn't sound right either...

"Yeah...special is a good word. He was a bit on the fruity side when I knew, but I heard he's been an angel comparatively since he's been here."

The man did manage to make her think he was one who had some good in him.  And oddly enough, while everything was left unconfirmed, she still believed that there was a chance that such a thing did exist somewhere in that man.

"... Oh." She sighed. "But... I'm at least glad someone who knows them both is helping clear Roy's name.  Thank you for looking in to this case, Richmond."

"You got it, miss. Richmond here will figure this thing out." Hopefully. "Let me know if you can think of anything else, and thanks for talking with me." Richmond smiled, flipping his coin up and catching it in the snowy air.

"I will." She said with a smile before bowing curtly again.

Ladies and Gents, never trust a sailor from Kanakan. 

So there I was, going about my business, working on some cases for the good people here, and the next thing I know I'm on a boat to some forsaken island down by old Scarlet Moon! I tell ya, those Kanakan traders, they're a crafty lot, I ended up doing dishes for them for 5 weeks! 5 weeks! These hands aren't meant for dishes, ya know. 

Suffice to say, Richmond here has to eat some mighty big crow and admit defeat in his expedition. I'm just happy to be back in Dunan...or I was until I heard all this racket about people in this castle. Seems no matter where I got, the Grasslands are the talk of the town. Can't blame a guy for being curious, right? <s>Although some of those Toran bastards tried. Sheesh, no one's got a sense of humor anymore....</s>

Like any good detective, I've been investigating this place for the last few weeks, working the scene and finding out all the interesting information and I've found one little piece that no one mentioned before: I've missed 18 years! I knew I shouldn't have bought that map off of that guy in Tinto, great miners, but above ground...sheesh. I think Sasuke said something about being teleported 18 years into the future, but he didn't say anything about it being now! You guys gotta let people know about this kinda stuff! Important information like that should be shared, yanno. 

Anyhow, so I've found a bit out about this place and the people in it. You're all an interesting bunch, eh? I've heard there's people back from the dead, from hundreds of years in the past (no wonder there's all those Island Nation kids up here) and even Luca Blight's kicking around somewhere! <s>although I'm not too sad not to see him, to tell ya the truth.</s>

So how about it, kids? You want to know something, just ask Richmond here and he'll figure it out.
